title: How to Survive a Jaguar Attack

steps.title: Take precaution in the forest.
steps.content: Take precaution in the forest. The last thing you want is a jaguar leaping onto your back unexpectedly from a tree! [1] X Research source

steps.title: Don't draw attention to yourself.
steps.content: Don't draw attention to yourself. If you see a jaguar that doesn't spot you, then don't disturb it.

steps.title: Back away slowly.
steps.content: Back away slowly. If the jaguar spots you, avoid eye contact, this can be seen as a challenge.

steps.title: Don't run.
steps.content: Don't run. You will be viewed as prey. Plus, jaguars are much faster than you. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Ready yourself for an attack.
steps.content: Ready yourself for an attack. If the jaguar charges at you, don't run, instead, hold your ground, wave your arms and shout, making yourself seem bigger and more dangerous than you really are.

steps.title: Fight back as hard as you can.
steps.content: Fight back as hard as you can. If the jaguar does not stop charging, poking it in the eye or punching it on the nose could well discourage it from pressing its attack.

steps.title: Protect the back of your head if the jaguar does not stop.
steps.content: Protect the back of your head if the jaguar does not stop. The jaguar is a very unusual killer. Rather than biting the neck, it goes for the back of the head to pierce the brain and kill the prey. Protecting your head could help you survive, although this cat has very strong teeth. [3] X Research source
